result.execSummary:
The defendant Rae-Ann T Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and domestic surcharges by 10-20-16 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; No Huber privileges. COURT OBJECTS TO ANY TRANSFER TO ANOTHER COUNTY. COURT OBJECTS TO ES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rae-Ann T Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed:  Decision and Order Denying Motion for Reconsideration of Sentence.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR RECONSIDERATION OF SENTENCE   RECEIVED AND FILED.

Defendant Rae-Ann T Allen in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Rae-Ann T Allen in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve SIX MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. NO Huber privileges. COURT OBJECTS TO ANY TRANSFER TO ANOTHER COUNTY. COURT OBJECTS TO ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY  court costs, fees and domestic  surcharges by 10-20-16 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Rae-Ann T Allen not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court informed defense counsel that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Ackerman Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Siefert, Br. 47. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. NO DISTRICT ATTORNEY FILE IN COURT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Rae-Ann T Allen not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per defense counsel this case was scheduled for a pre-trial conference however, no future court date was added in CCAP.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court withdrew any warrants that may be outstanding on this case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gerri Batiste DOB 1/19/1959.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rae-Ann T Allen in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Rae-Ann T Allen in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Rae-Ann T Allen not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/21/15 @ 1:30 pm
